intro: Grindelia hirsutula var. brevisquama, commonly known as the short-hairy globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and yellow composite flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant thrives in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its ability to tolerate drought conditions. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in its native habitat.
